intro: Gonzalagunia panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America, specifically Panama. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, often growing in moist, shaded areas of forests. Gonzalagunia panamensis is notable for its nocturnal blooming habit and its ecological importance as a food source for certain pollinators.
